Package controller

Class UIBoardActions

java.lang.Object
controller.UIBoardActions
public class UIBoardActions extends Object
This class contains utility methods for handling user interaction with the UI Tic-Tac-Toe board, which is clicking the tiles. It handles score keeping, turn switching, notifying the user of a win or tie, and updating the board with the player symbols whenever appropriate.

    The user interface TicTacToe board which will get updated and display the moves of the players after every move is made.

  • Field Details

    • UIBoard

      private static javafx.scene.layout.GridPane UIBoard
      The user interface TicTacToe board which will get updated and display the moves of the players after every move is made. null represents that the user hasn't created a UI board yet.

    • board

      private static TicTacToeBoard board
      Defines the logic, state, and data associated with the board that will be used to update the UI board, switch turns, update scores, and notify the user of a tie or win.

    • playerOneLabel

      private static javafx.scene.control.Label playerOneLabel
      Displays player one's symbol and score and appears green whenever it is player one's turn. It alters between green and white text fill, and gets its score updated based on user and/or computer interaction with the UI board.

    • playerTwoLabel

      private static javafx.scene.control.Label playerTwoLabel
      Displays player two's symbol and score and appears green whenever it is player one's turn. It alters between green and white text fill, and gets its score updated based on user and/or computer interaction with the UI board.

  • Constructor Details

    • UIBoardActions

      public UIBoardActions()

  • Method Details

    • getUIBoard

      public static javafx.scene.layout.GridPane getUIBoard(TicTacToeBoard initBoard, javafx.scene.control.Label initPlayerOneLabel, javafx.scene.control.Label initPlayerTwoLabel)
      Create a GridPane as a UI board representation of the Tic-Tac-Toe board using the UIElements class, and define what to do when a user clicks a tile on the board.
      Parameters:
      initPlayerOneLabel - label displaying the name, symbol, and score of player one. this label is associated with this instance of a UI board.
      initPlayerTwoLabel - Label displaying the name, symbol, and score of player two. this label is associated with this instance of a UI board.
      initBoard - TicTacToeBoard object that contains the logic and game state for the Tic-Tac-Toe game. this TicTacToeBoad is associated with this instance of a UI board.
      Returns:
      A UI GridPane representation of the TicTacToeBoard board

    • computerTurn

      public static void computerTurn()
      Simulate the computer player's move on the Tic-Tac-Toe game. Update the UI GridPane board with the new computer move, and update the player labels after a move. Additionally, check if there is a winner or a tie after the move is made.

    • checkWinner

      private static void checkWinner(GameState gameState)
      Helper method used after move is made on the board. If the current game state is a win or a tie, then create and display an appropriate end-of-game prompt. Also update the score in the label of the winning player, if there is one.
      Parameters:
      gameState - the current GameState of the game, to determine if the game has ended in a win or a tie

    • updatePlayerLabels

      private static void updatePlayerLabels()
      Helper method to update the color of the player labels to reflect the current player's turn.
